name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"643c7ddf-cca1-43c7-9222-d9db7cd8829d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: enter_call","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"67daae72-0833-4f78-a3b9-da187121a15b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"enter_call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function handles the transition of control flow during a function call. It performs two main tasks: documenting the dependency in the Call Graph (CG) and updating the analyzer's "stack" to simulate entering the called function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"30349996-e284-4379-8906-3a1130db7c9c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cfd6fde1-72ca-4341-ae6b-3e3f8b0ca3a0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Mapping:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" A static analyzer's primary output is often a dependency graph. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"helper()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there must be an edge ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main -> helper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This function explicitly creates that edge.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6ed7f155-25fd-4e8c-9774-550e82d06496","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Switching:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" While ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" processes the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"act","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of calling, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (called here) handles the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"context","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By pushing the called function onto the stack, the analyzer might (depending on configuration) trigger a re-analysis of that function's body or simply mark it as "visited" to avoid infinite recursion.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"35910669-2ef6-4ba9-a4e3-c4bf076250a2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8708c30f-f891-45ff-824c-dd88d7a037ea","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definition Retrieval:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It retrieves the definition of the function being called (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e0db8162-23d0-44a1-b841-f001e08acb3a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Graph Edge Creation:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"7afeedd1-e832-44ac-acce-603ea598d87e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Definitions:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the function is defined within the project (not ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"EXT_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it adds an edge from the current function (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.current_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to the called function (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3fd92b37-f18e-4cc9-a9b2-8e6b5c2779fe","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Built-ins:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the function is a recognized built-in (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"len","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it also adds an edge, ensuring usage of standard library features is tracked.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"97ab3215-d5f9-4f42-b5aa-bd18a3a0b98d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"External Filtering:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It generally avoids adding edges to purely external, unresolved definitions to keep the graph focused on the project's own code, unless specifically configured otherwise.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"83ee2fc2-f23e-496e-8d98-6a9e0b0b9673","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Stack Update:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.pushStack(callDefi)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This is the mechanism that "enters" the function. If recursion is allowed and useful, the visitor might jump to that function's body; otherwise, it records the visit and pops back out.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cfbe3682-7e68-47e2-82cd-3ac5adc4016d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c3e35c3a-845f-4da9-bb4f-48392bb7bb69","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"def start():
    run()","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8ecf870e-a47b-4676-bdc1-99b8ce97c540","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inside ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"run()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1be36424-ee2a-4105-867a-f1f010c82a1a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"enter_call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is invoked with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"run","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d816f998-41dd-4423-978e-2ec9c5ad0721","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It verifies ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"run","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an internal function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"696a588e-a060-4486-99dc-498baf5d17a7","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It adds an edge to the graph: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"start -> run","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1e09c320-beeb-4aec-a400-a23946609393","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It pushes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"run","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" onto the stack, changing the active context.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c89c900b-df97-463a-93b0-99ba7d0b3222","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
